meanings.definition: A sudden or unexpected change or substitution.
meanings.sent1: The magician performed a switcheroo with the cards, leaving the audience amazed.
meanings.sent2: I did a switcheroo with my lunch and traded my sandwich for a cookie.
meanings.sent3: The switcheroo of the actors in the play confused the audience but made them laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her sudden switcheroo from shy to confident was like a butterfly emerging from its cocoon.
meanings.sent5: The switcheroo in the weather caught everyone off guard, turning a sunny day into a stormy one.

meanings.definition: To make a sudden or unexpected change or substitution.
meanings.sent1: She likes to switcheroo her hairstyle often, keeping everyone guessing.
meanings.sent2: I had to switcheroo my plans last minute when my friend canceled on me.
meanings.sent3: The kids decided to switcheroo their toys, causing a playful chaos in the room.
meanings.sent4: His decision to switcheroo his major in college was a bold move towards his passion.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to switcheroo the ingredients in the recipe, resulting in a surprisingly delicious dish.
